parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.56

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Config

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Mission Information

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns value of the given scenario attribute from the 1st tier. Since only config properties have values, the attribute should be config property. If it is not found or config class is given, the return is [[nil]]. If the attribute defined in multiple places, the command checks them in the following order:
# External ''[[Description.ext]]'' file
# [[Eden_Editor:_Scenario_Atttributes|Eden Editor]] scenario attribute
So if attribute exists in both places, attribute from [[description.ext]] is used. Previously, scenario attributes were extracted from ''Description.ext'' using [[missionConfigFile]]. That still works, but it ignores attributes set directly in the editor and it should not be used anymore.<br><br>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> This command cannot force return type, it will return the value of the type given in config. Use [[isEqualType]] to additionally reaffirm the correct type if necessary to account for human error.</value></part></template>  

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''getMissionConfigValue''' attribute
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> attribute: [[String]] - attribute name
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]], [[String]] or [[Array]], depending on the attribute value type. [[nil|Nil]] when the attribute is undefined.

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> '''getMissionConfigValue''' [attribute, defaultValue]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value>  attribute: [[String]] - attribute name
</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value>  defaultValue: [[Anything]] - value used when the attribute is undefined
</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Number]], [[String]] or [[Array]], depending on the attribute value type. Default value when the attribute is undefined.

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_respawnDelay = [[getMissionConfigValue]] ["respawnDelay",0]</code>
Returns respawn delay value. Replaces the previous approach which would scan only the external ''Description.ext file'', but ignore the value set in the Eden Editor:
<code>_respawnDelay = [[getNumber]] ([[missionConfigFile]] >> "respawnDelay"); // Old approach</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getMissionConfig]], [[missionConfigFile]]
</value></part></template></root>
